intro: Glochidion bracteatum, commonly known as the bracteate glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small yellow flowers, which are typically surrounded by bracts that are brightly colored. Glochidion bracteatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
